title: Was there a difference between the melting point of 2-naphthol and 2-bitoxynaphthalene? Explain the reason for this. - Quora

response.answer_text: I think that you might mean 2-butoxynaphthalene which indeed has a significantly lower melting point (35–36 degrees) than 2-naphthol (121–123 degrees). This is because the hydrocarbon “tail” in 2-butoxynaphthalene gives the molecule some fatty properties and lowers the melting point. You can see this trend in the melting points of 2-methoxynaphthalene (72 degrees) and 2-ethoxynaphthalene (37.5 degrees).
It is possible that I’m misreading the second compound or that you miswrote some portion of it. Either way, would you review and clarify your query?
